result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Anastacio P Villegas Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. OWI Transcript fee to be forwarded to the District Attorney's office.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

To ATTEND a Victim Impact Panel Meeting. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Complete an Alcohol Assessment. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Adam Stuart and Assistant District Attorney Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Michelle R. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 2 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION:  36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel  

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $8.00 (to be paid to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office) 

FINE:  $1,569.00  $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500.00) and remainder to be returned to poster)

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Character letter and sentencing information filed by Atty Kershek.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
